name: camas
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant found in North America with purple or blue flowers and a bulb (= a round root from which the plant grows) that can be cooked and eaten: The meadows were a sea of camas and other wild flowers. The bulb of the camas is good to eat once baked, with a taste a bit like a sweet potato.
More examplesFewer examplesCamas was an important part of the diet of indigenous North American peoples and became a widely traded product.Camas bulbs were dried to provide food for the winter.Although its true home is on the prairies, camas can be successfully grown in your garden.
